headline: Beto O'Rourke goes all-in on gun control at Democratic presidential debate

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello, everyone. I'm Juan Williams along with Emily Compagno, Jesse Watters, Dana Perino, and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City, this is “The Five.” Fox News alert, actress Felicity Huffman headed to prison, a judge sentencing her to 14 days behind bars, a $30,000 fine, and one year probation. Huffman is the first parent to face punishment in the bombshell college admission scandal. The Hollywood star admitted to paying $15,000 to rig her daughter's SAT's score. Huffman crying in court, showing remorse and admitting she broke the law, but the judge siding with the prosecutors who pushed for prison time instead of just probation. The news not just impacting Huffman, you should know that others involved in the cheating scheme including Lori Loughlin who pleaded not guilty are still awaiting their fate. Dana, let me go to you. This is very interesting in that, you know, the prosecutors had asked for a year -- one month to 15 months. She ends up now with 14 day sentence, is that fair?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.utterance: Well, you know, what her lawyers were saying that she should probably be allowed just to have probation, and to stay at home, and maybe do 250 hours of community service. However, because, remember, if this is a financial situation where she has a lot of money. So, having her pay a big fine is not really a punishment because they have plenty of money. That could -- $30,000 fine for somebody else would be really out of reach. I do think that prosecutors are saying we've got to send a message. She's not going to be able to stay at home in her Hollywood Hills luxury with an infinity pool. They actually used those words. And so, I think that this is a sign that the other parents that are awaiting their sentencing, because many of them pled guilty, they're probably going to face the same thing. I do wonder what Lori Loughlin is thinking though, because if she -- this goes to trial, if she wins, she wins, and then maybe all of this stuff is for not. But if she loses, she's probably looking at a lot more time than -- I'm looking at Emily, because I don't really know. But I'm assuming she would be looking at a lot more time than 14 days.

utterances.speaker: EMILY COMPAGNO, HOST
utterances.utterance: Right. And we've talked about this before that when you go to white collar crime federal detention facilities, essentially all the people in there with 10 year and 15 year sentences, those are not the ones who pled out. Those are the ones who went to trial and it's the juries that level these harsh sentences all the time. You and I talk about earlier, too, the fact that I was worried, frankly, as a citizen that she would get zero prison time because, for me -- first of all, the government punishes inchoate crimes, right? There's a reason why conspiracies are illegal. It's not just about whether you actually went through with it, or whether the crime was actually able to be committed and there was some type of, quote, victim that people have been arguing. Here, even the probation office said, well, it's an economic offense. It was actually a lot more than that and it was straight up fraud. And so, I have seen for a tax evasion case for a few thousand dollars probation office deny and refuse to endorse someone requesting home confinement with a disabled dependent. And here she was arguing for one with her infinity pool. As the prosecutor said, she was morally clueless and it was out of a sense of entitlement only. So I'm 100 percent am grateful that she, at least, got some jail time.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. So, Jesse, I'm gonna -- if that was the prosecution's case, let me give you the defense case, right? She said she did this out of maternal devotion, insecurity. Her daughter has a learning disability. And the daughter, by the way, got a 1420 on the SAT score out of a max of 1600. And her lawyer said she's remorseful. You know, there's no need to jail her because the message to the other parents is don't do this. And there's no need to put this talented actress in jail.

utterances.utterance: Juan, you know the truth.

utterances.utterance: All right. And I see you nodding.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.utterance: William H. Macy? You mean William Hussein Macy? I have an infinity pool. Do you know what it is? You just climb in the tub and I crank me some journey.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Nice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, you know it. Save the journey fan. I can safely say she'll be the only person in prison named Felicity, you know. That's all I got.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I really don't -- honestly, I've got it tell you. I really don't care about this story and I'm happy that we lead with this story because it means the news is good. The economy is good. Everything is going great. So this is the big story on the most popular TV show in America. This one. The big lesson here, of course, children are a pain in the butt. So if you have a sloth, you don't have to worry about sending a sloth to college, right? But you've got kids. All they do is want, want, want. Children just get in the way of your drinking. She's gonna be -- she's going to go away. And you're right, Jesse. You're right. This is why I have applied the brakes on my explosive stardom, because I know that the higher I sail, the higher I go in the sky, the more people will gonna want to see me fall, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That was self-imposed?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's self-imposed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I turned down a lot of acting gigs, a lot -- award show hosting because I know that, like, the bigger I get, the bigger the fall.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So I'm kind of keeping it low on The Five. I'm hanging out with you guys. I'm one of The Five. It's kind of cool just to be -- kind of like, you know, people say hello to me on the street, but it's not like I'm mobbed the way I used to be.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right. Well, you're doing a very big job of keeping yourself out of the stardom.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But this is the biggest show. I mean, this is the big story today. That's good news. We should be happy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Is it really Hussein? Is that really --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, William Hussein Macy. You're not talking about it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Before we --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Shep totally ignored that part.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I know. Before we indulged your modesty, I wanted to raise one last point --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- which is, in Atlanta, public school teachers and administrators principals were sentenced to three years in jail for cheating on state test scores. An Ohio mom who gave the wrong address to get her kid into a suburban -- better suburban school, guess what? She got jail time.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Cory Booker had a great line at the debate last night. He said if your -- it's better to be rich and guilty than poor and innocent in the criminal justice system in this country.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Black and white.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm just talking about your point in Atlanta.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Trump should partner.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He should partner.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Felicity? Felicity?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, Felicity.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're my favorite housewife.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're not going to be desperate.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. All right. Things got heated in Houston, highlights from the Democratic debate, including the clash between Julian Castro and Joe Biden. It's up next. And later, oh, my gosh, we had a blast with the animals on set yesterday, but there's so much more that we didn't get to show you. So, stick around. More on “The Five.”

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: 2020 Democrats facing off in a fiery debate filled with big progressive promises and personal insults. The top 10 liberal candidates sharing the stage for the first time hitting on healthcare, gun control, climate change, immigration, and taking cheap shots at President Trump. And, of course, their socialist big government proposals were on full display.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Cancel student loan debt for 95 percent of the folks who've got it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: My campaign will now give a freedom dividend of $1,000 a month for an entire year to 10 American families, someone watching this at home right now.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Universal pre-K and universal healthcare, unleashing millions of new jobs in the clean energy economy.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: We will address the catastrophic crisis of climate change and transform our energy system away from fossil fuel.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But the big moment of the night everyone is talking about is Julian Castro going after Joe Biden with this attack.

utterances.speaker: JULIAN CASTRO, PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: Barack Obama's vision was not to leave 10 million people uncovered. He wanted every single person in this country covered. My plan would do that, your plan would not.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: They do not have to buy in. They do not have to buy in.

utterances.speaker: CASTRO
utterances.utterance: You just said that. You just said that two minutes ago. You just said two minutes ago that they would have to buy in.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: CASTRO
utterances.utterance: You said they would have to buy in.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: -- buy in to qualify for Medicaid, it's automatic --

utterances.speaker: CASTRO
utterances.utterance: Are you forgetting what you said two minutes ago? Are you forgetting already what you said just two minutes ago? I mean, I can't believe that you said two minutes ago that they had to buy in and now you're saying they don't have to buy. You're forgetting that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Castro's low blow setting off the rest of the Democrats on the debate stage.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: This is why --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Come on, guys. Come on.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: -- presidential debates are becoming unwatchable. This reminds everybody of what they cannot stand about Washington.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Scoring points against each other, poking at each other, and telling each other that your -- my plan, your plan -- look, we all --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, that's called the Democratic primary election. It's called an election. That's an election.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: You know, this is what we're here for. It's an election.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, but a house divided cannot stand. And that is not how --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Everyone, we know we're on the same team here. We know we're on the same team. We all have a better vision for healthcare than our current president.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, God. Castro refusing to back down claiming his dig at Biden's memory wasn't a personal attack, but instead about policy. Dana, that was just -- it was just awkward watching those people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, the thing is -- Castro intended to do that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And so, he was like I'll be the one. I'll be the one -- the first one on the debate stage, like the media has been doing it, other people have been saying that Biden has lost his step. I'm going to be the one to do it. And then he chose his moment, but then he was wrong about the moment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. So, if you're going to do that, you have to have -- you have to nail it and there could have been other opportunities for him to do so. The crowd didn't really like it. The rest of the people didn't like it. And what Joe Biden is able to do now is to fund raise off of it. The thing is, I thought about this, one of the things we didn't play much sound from Bernie Sanders. So this is the third debate where -- now we have analysis and nobody is talking about Bernie Sanders. He hasn't had a moment. He maintains his poll average, but I think that's about as far as he's ever going to get. And Elizabeth Warren basically acts like a general election candidate.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, same thing. Not a lot of news from Warren either. Greg, did anybody distinguish themselves or stand out in any way?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I thought I did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I thought I did. I'm watching the mainstream media rushing to defend this old white male against this young Hispanic man. What kind of white privilege are they protecting? You know, I thought the -- I thought what happened was I think he stepped into this thing, and when the audience made that sound, it created momentum for him. That's why I think he kind of like embraced that moment, and there was no grace or elegance to the criticism --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- because it was -- he was more like Oscar Mayer not Oscar Wilde. He was just kind of clunky. But having said that, I'm a little bit tired of the white knighting that's going on with Biden. You know, I mean, I get it. It was a pretty lame predictable insult. But watching everybody protecting poor Joe from Castro, that's a little rich for me. I think Joe should take a few barbs, especially when he is screwing up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right, I mean, I don't like listening to Buttigieg --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, the lecture from Buttigieg.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- and Klobucher saying, you know, this is not what the audience wants. It's exactly what the audience wants. The audience wants to see people kind of distinguish themselves from the other candidates and compete to see who's going to be the nominee. Do you disagree with that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah. I think you want to be able to draw a distinction, but you don't necessarily want a personal attack that seems insidious.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It came off as nasty, I agree.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. So I don't think people need that and, especially -- I mean, this is the key point. I think Democrats say, hey, wait a second. This sounds a lot like Trump Republican attacks that, oh, he might be too old. Oh, Joe has lost a step. Oh, Joe is not mentally --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You guys have been doing that to Trump for three years. You're calling him insane, demented.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait a second. One has a basis. We're talking --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm saying -- when you see this among Democrats, the response from Democrats wasn't to protect Joe Biden. It was to say you went too far. And, you know, Castro was having a good debate. I mean, he told that wonderful story about being a lawyer who gave up his law practice to vote on principle, and the city council (INAUDIBLE). It all went away, because -- the only thing everybody is talking about today is the fact that he went after Joe Biden in this way. I think there are a lot of people on that stage, I suspect they might be in there October. They're not going to be around in November, December.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And they feel they needed to go after the frontrunner, but they didn't do this. You notice, Elizabeth Warren did not take him on. It was Castro and Booker.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He should blame his twin brother.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, also, what about the sound that we heard at the top, too? All those people promising we're going to cancel your debt. We're going to pay for everything. Universal pre-K. We're not even going to raise taxes. I think Liz Warren for the fifth time says I will not admit that I'm going to raise taxes on the middle class to pay for universal healthcare. She gets away with it.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Interestingly, I felt that she did it a little more artfully than some of the other candidates who simply dodged questions and it was pretty blaring. If I can speak to that moment for a second, though.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: The Julian struck me as someone who, like, shows up prepared for a fight. He came with so much energy and he wanted it to be combative, and then everyone else kind of had their typical response to it, and that he wanted it to be this gladiator staged for TV moment and that speaks to the live audience quality, but everyone else was kind of seeing it as big picture. And I feel like I'm an outlier in this. But I have to say I have no idea how Biden has gotten the approval he got from last night. I found him appalling. And, yet, some of the mainstream media coverage of him called him decent up from disaster last time and reassuring. I found his response to the questions of systemic racism, as I said, literally appalling. And to me, he showed that he was disqualifying, that he will not be able to take on Trump in any form or fashion because he's unable to even engage in a conversation about the systemic racism that people on the left are wanting to ask about. And I'm not just talking about the slim part of the voters or that audience where it's particularly relevant. I am talking about the entire Democratic Party. I do not understand why they don't see him as 100 percent disqualified.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, his biggest base of support, black voters.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And I -- so, you said you're appalled. Are you talking about that moment when he says record player and people say what are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes. And the larger notion, yes. The larger notion that the state should come in to the homes of a certain group of people that he was intimating, and that also by not being specific in terms of who is poor, and that saying, oh, but teachers know best. And also in response to the answer of why should Latinos trust you, that he came out of the gate lying and said, well, we didn't do this and we didn't do that. Yes, the Obama administration did and here's photographic evidence. And also the insinuating question, why should African-Americans trust you when we're asking you about your --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not only that, I mean, he whiffed on Afghanistan. He whiffed on Iraq. Bernie took it to him pretty hard a few times on the Iraq war, which was pretty ugly. And I think he was good in the beginning when he was talking about healthcare and faded throughout the rest.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you know what we're not talking about is Kamala? I mean it's --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: She had a terrible debate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She tried to come in with the Trump hits. Thinking those would be memorable and it was just so --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And then laughing at her own jokes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Who laughs at your own jokes?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Never would do such a thing. That was a jab at me, Dana.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She does come off as inauthentic, and I think the audience can see that because a lot if it looks scripted. All right. Stay right there, we've got more big moments from the Democratic debate including Beto's promise to come take your guns.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. Top Democrats facing off at the third debate in Houston last night. There were a lot of heated clashes and big moments including this one from Beto O'Rourke pouring gasoline on the gun control debate. Watch.

utterances.speaker: BETO O'ROURKE, PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: If it's a weapon that was designed to kill people on a battlefield. Hell yes, we're going to take your AR-15, your AK-47. You're not going to be allowed to use against a fellow Americans anymore.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: There's a lot to talk about on this particular topic. Let's start with Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If his fantasy came true, do you think he would be the guy that would be knocking on the doors? No, it will be a poor police officer, cop, who'll be forced into high risk situations a million times over. Beto is advocating a plan that would lead to many violent confrontations. It's impossible. I think about Eric Garner, and I know why -- Eric Garner died in a police action. But the police action wouldn't have happened if they didn't have a stupid ass law banning the selling of loose cigarettes. That's what led to that confrontation to that death. So it's not necessarily the police confrontation that lead to violence, it's the stupid laws. This could end with -- he's so stupid. This could end in countless tragic confrontations, and it made me see the light about the red flag -- I've been talking about the red flags laws for the last, I don't know, couple of years.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: In support.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: As a support of the red flags laws. Now when I see this self- absorbed twerp, you know, basically saying he will report you. He will report you and take your gun. He's basically validating every NRA apostle. He's basically saying, yeah, you're right. I'm going to come for your guns. And you know what? I'm going to report you. If I think that you said something threatening in a tweet, I'm going to go to the FBI, so they can take your gun away. That's what people are going to think about now when they hear about the red flag -- when they hear about the red flag law, they're going to think that's the type of guy who's going to take our guns away.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Think about how many crazy liberals would just kind of fake rat on their conservative enemies and say I saw this guy abusing his wife. I saw this guy abusing his kid. You better show up to his house and take his gun. It's going to weaponized the red flag laws. And, you know, I don't think he would pass a background check. I mean, you know what happened to him? He ate dirt. That's not normal. So I think when you go out there and you say I'm going to go door-to-door and take your legally purchased weapon, that's why we designed so many years ago the second amendment to protect us from people like him. And notice he's the only one saying it? A couple of the other people have supported it in theory. He's the only one crazy enough or desperate enough to say it. And that's not just going to haunt the Democrats in 2020. That will haunt them for so many more elections, and this is going to get replayed all the time on television because he -- a year ago when he was running for the Texas senate, he said, no, keep your guns if they were legally purchased. We're not going to touch them. Now he's flip flopped.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He has closed off a path for him to win statewide in Texas --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- with this. But, Juan, what do you think that -- you know, there was a big audience support?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I was about to say, you know, I mean, I'm listening to you as my friends, but I think there's a whole different set of reactions, not only in that auditorium in Houston --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's a college campus.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm just saying, I think those were Democrats, and I think that across the country today there's a sense that he went through a trauma in terms of the shooting in El Paso, and that he had a genuine and personal statement. That it was not political because I'm listening to the reaction from all of you. You say, well, typically Democrats trim their sails on this, so that you can say, oh, well , they're not going to come - get - no, he said it right there. You know what, if you have a gun that's made for the battlefield, you shouldn't have it in your home. And he explained his position and I think that's not only you saw the response from the audience, Dana. The other people on stage all said, Beto, you did a great job.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, you think that people going door-to-door taking legally purchased weapons?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Weapons is a good idea.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's fear mongering.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because that's actually going to cause more violence.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Hell yes, we'll take it. He said it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no. I think he has, in fact, this is interesting to my political mind in that I think he has now pushed to an extent in terms of being more extreme. He's pushed that middle in terms of what is acceptable in terms of gun controls, it's like the--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But what about something like me who moved towards the middle.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Corporate executive this week coming out, we need to do some--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Like I move towards - I have open discussions with people on both sides about these red flag things. He's screwed that debate up. You can't talk about it anymore, because now people are going to point to that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, I think in fact what I see in terms of your reaction, he's triggered the Right-wing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, Juan. What this is going to do--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He's triggered the NRA.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This is going to cost more lives than mass shootings would cost.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're kidding me. You're going to go to people and say, hey, hand it over. Give it the hell to me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what you're involved in pressing fear buttons and speculation.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, OK. So, let me ask you, if I'm a reporter - let me be serious with you for a second.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's not speculation.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let me - just listen.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's not speculation.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If you're a reporter, I would ask Beto, what is the mechanism that you're going to go about and then disarm the country. How is it actually going to happen and what do you think he's going to say?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think he'd say, the point is we are in a country that has too many guns--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, Juan. What is the actual method that he's going to take the guns?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We can have that discussion. He has an answer--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would like to see him answer that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I'm going to tell you something when we have kids going in these training sessions now where they're under the table in every public school in America, it's shameful.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What about the law?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Look, I totally hear what you're saying. And I think and I'm hearing you in that after his vicarious trauma, he is responding emotionally and that's fine. Then that's totally authentic for him. But as a presidential candidate, it is intellectually lazy and I think it's from a position of privilege that you can oversimplify this issue and you can scream about what is a confiscation and think that it would work, that it would fly legally, that it would fly politically and that you would have the support of this entire country when we know we don't have enough time for it. But when we know the myriad reasons it wouldn't work, especially because it would end in violence and because it wouldn't work in terms of sheer numbers and because of the serial component of all of these guns and all the registration needed and et cetera, et cetera. Everything would fall through the cracks. So, to me I see it as perhaps coming from a place of authenticity, but absolutely ineffective. And it will never fly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I wish I'd hear you guys speak about the extremist and the NRA in this way.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Beto is the extremist.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I mean look, 80, 90 percent of American say, we got to do something.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: People of the NRA are causing the mass shootings.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We don't have to do something unconstitutional.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Guns for everybody.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. Next, if you thought our live Animals Are Great was fun, wait until you see all the stuff, we didn't get to show you. Watch.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. We now have scientific proof that animals are great. According to studies having cute pets can relieve stress, dampen depression, raise your tolerance for pain and even improve your marriage. And those are just some of the benefits. These guys learned that firsthand when the Columbus Zoo brought some very special friends on set including a penguin, a lynx, a kangaroo and a sloth. You guys. That must have just been the best day of all time. But I've heard that you got bit? Can you tell?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well no. The penguin just hit me in the face which I'm used to.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Did you deserve it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think, I got a little too close. Although that penguin was a horny little devil, he tried to have sex with our - Dana, the hair person, not Dana, the cast person and then tried to have sex with one of these--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Dana is not a type.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. This penguin was amazing because we were all talking about the most confident animal, I've ever seen in my life walks in here. Just reroll the tape. But anyway, you walk it in. Just wall a little round and just like check it out the women. I was told he prefers humans over animals.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And he likes the camera.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He loves the camera. He should be on TV.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: That makes me happy if he loves humans more. So that he's not you know--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It is really true about the--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
